title: Optimize pow for common exponents
body_html:
Fixes #2618.

For THC, I reused the "recently" implemented THCNumerics::pow to simplify the code.
There is not as much gain in THC compared to TH though (in the order of 30%), but I added it anyway.

If we want to squeeze performance even further, we could handle the in-place case when the exponent is 1 and just return without performing any computation.
body_text:
Fixes #2618.
For THC, I reused the "recently" implemented THCNumerics::pow to simplify the code.
There is not as much gain in THC compared to TH though (in the order of 30%), but I added it anyway.
If we want to squeeze performance even further, we could handle the in-place case when the exponent is 1 and just return without performing any computation.
body:
Fixes https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/2618.

For `THC`, I reused the "recently" implemented `THCNumerics::pow` to simplify the code.
There is not as much gain in THC compared to TH though (in the order of 30%), but I added it anyway.

If we want to squeeze performance even further, we could handle the in-place case when the exponent is 1 and just return without performing any computation.
